fileContent.data:
Chief Complaint
Left hip pain. [cite: 1][cite_start]
HPI
The patient is a 51-year-old female presenting for a follow-up visit regarding persistent left hip pain. [cite: 1] [cite_start]She has a history of severe osteoarthritis with bone-on-bone changes confirmed on imaging. [cite: 1] [cite_start]She underwent a successful right total hip arthroplasty (12/6/2024) and reports good function on that side. [cite: 1] [cite_start]However, the left hip continues to cause significant stiffness and pain, radiating into the thigh and posterior hip, aggravated by ambulation and partially relieved with rest. [cite: 1] [cite_start]Pain disrupts sleep and limits daily activities. [cite: 1] [cite_start]The patient has tried multiple conservative measures including weight loss (volitional loss of ~70 lbs), activity modification, analgesics, NSAIDs, and physical therapy without sufficient relief. [cite: 1] [cite_start]She has also undergone bilateral knee radiofrequency ablations (2022) with some improvement, but her knees remain arthritic and symptomatic. [cite: 1] [cite_start]She is motivated to proceed with left total hip arthroplasty to improve mobility and function. [cite: 1] [cite_start]Recent hospitalization (July 23-August 15, 2025) at Henry Ford/Harbor Oaks was for management of bipolar disorder type II, with adjustment of psychiatric medications. [cite: 1] [cite_start]She required a walker during admission due to hip pain. [cite: 1] [cite_start]She currently weighs ~220 lbs (BMI ~30, down from BMI 39). [cite: 1] [cite_start]She is a daily smoker (1 pack/day). [cite: 1][cite_start]
Past Surgical History
Right total hip arthroplasty (12/6/2024) [cite: 1][cite_start]
Bilateral genicular nerve radiofrequency ablations (2022) [cite: 1][cite_start]
Bilateral knee arthroscopies (dates not specified) [cite: 1][cite_start]
Past Medical History
Osteoarthritis: bilateral hips and knees [cite: 1][cite_start]
Bipolar disorder type II [cite: 1][cite_start]
Depression (early adulthood, later reclassified as bipolar disorder) [cite: 1][cite_start]
Obesity (prior BMI 39, now BMI ~30 after 70 lb weight loss) [cite: 1][cite_start]
COPD (noted in October 2024 evaluation) [cite: 1][cite_start]
Tobacco use: 1 pack/day smoker [cite: 1][cite_start]
Medications
Celecoxib 400 mg daily PRN (prescribed 8/25/2025) [cite: 1][cite_start]
Topical lidocaine 5% ointment, apply to affected area TID-QID (prescribed 8/25/2025) [cite: 1][cite_start]
Psychiatric medications (adjusted during July-August 2025 admission, not specified) [cite: 1][cite_start]
Tylenol PRN [cite: 1][cite_start]
Allergies
No known drug allergies reported. [cite: 1][cite_start]
Social History
Married, lives with husband. [cite: 1] [cite_start]Not currently working; wishes to return to work postoperatively. [cite: 1] [cite_start]Daily smoker (~1 pack/day). [cite: 1] [cite_start]Denies illicit drug use. [cite: 1] [cite_start]Alcohol: social use. [cite: 1] [cite_start]History of MVA (June 2024), case settled. [cite: 1][cite_start]
Vitals
Height: 5'9" [cite: 1][cite_start]
Weight: ~220 lbs [cite: 1][cite_start]
BMI: ~30 (Obesity 1) [cite: 1]

Chief Complaint
Left hip pain and right-sided pain following motor vehicle accident. [cite: 2][cite_start]
History of Present Illness (HPI)
51-year-old female returns for follow-up of her scheduled left total hip replacement (THA) and discloses a new motor vehicle accident (MVA) on June 4, 2025, previously not reported at intake. [cite: 2] [cite_start]She was driving alone on 12 Mile Road near the GM Tech facility during a nighttime rainstorm when she lost control and struck a fence. [cite: 2] [cite_start]She reports loss of consciousness and did not immediately recognize she had been in an accident. [cite: 2] [cite_start]She later presented to Ascension McComb Hospital with right hip and low back pain. [cite: 2] [cite_start]A police report was filed, and she received a ticket for leaving the scene, which she attributes to confusion and head injury. [cite: 2] [cite_start]Left THA is scheduled for 08/20/2025. [cite: 2] [cite_start]She reports excellent response to prior right THA (12/06/2024). [cite: 2] [cite_start]Patient is under care with Dr. Bradley for chronic pain management, receiving OxyContin and prior knee injections. [cite: 2] [cite_start]She has lost ~90 lbs, reducing from ~300 to 210 lbs via diet alone. [cite: 2] [cite_start]She is being treated by Dr. Jeffrey Schwab (podiatrist) for hammer toe. [cite: 2][cite_start]
Past Surgical History
Right Total Hip Arthroplasty 12/06/2024 [cite: 2][cite_start]
Left Knee Arthroscopy - 2016 [cite: 2][cite_start]
Right Knee Meniscectomy 2012 [cite: 2][cite_start]
Bilateral Geniculate + Cutaneous Nerve RFAS - 2022 [cite: 2][cite_start]
Past Medical History
Bipolar disorder [cite: 2][cite_start]
History of COPD [cite: 2][cite_start]
Chronic pain [cite: 2][cite_start]
BMI 30.3 (formerly 39.6) [cite: 2][cite_start]
History of head trauma (MVA-related) [cite: 2][cite_start]
PCP: Dr. Asima Hussain [cite: 2][cite_start]
Medications
Celebrex 400 mg once daily PRN [cite: 2][cite_start]
Lidocaine 5% ointment apply QID [cite: 2][cite_start]
Oxycodone active Rx from pain doctor [cite: 2][cite_start]
Cyclobenzaprine - previously prescribed by ER [cite: 2][cite_start]
Risperidone, Adderall XR, Benztropine, Lamictal, Tegretol, Senna-S, Aspirin 81 mg, Albuterol [cite: 2][cite_start]
Allergies
No known drug allergies. [cite: 2][cite_start]
Social History
Right-handed [cite: 2][cite_start]
On disability [cite: 2][cite_start]
Light smoker, light marijuana use (10-25 years) [cite: 2][cite_start]
Denies alcohol [cite: 2][cite_start]
Vitals
Height: 5'9" [cite: 2][cite_start]
Weight: 205 lbs [cite: 2][cite_start]
BMI: 30.3 [cite: 2]

painSymptoms.ChiefComplaint: Pt states she's here for B hips [cite: 3] Scheduled for surgery L hip on 8/20 but canceled because she was having issues with the R hip; R hip replacement 12/11/24 [cite: 3] Auto accident 6/4/25 [cite: 3] R hip worse than L hip [cite: 3] Stiffness comes and goes [cite: 3] Worse with cold and not moving [cite: 3] Better with moving around and oxycodone [cite: 3] Pain wakes pt up sometimes [cite: 3] States she thinks she's having issues with R hip because she only went to PT 3 times [cite: 3]

activeMedications.instructions: Take one capsule by mouth once daily with food as need for pain.
Every month apply small amount 4 times daily
take 4 pills 1 hour prior to dental procedure. following Rx procedure, take 1 pill BID for 3 days.
Take one tablet by mouth every 4 hours as needed for acute post op pain, dispense #42 (forty two), No refill.
Take one tablet by mouth once to twice a day PRN constipation dispense #60(sixty) No refill

activeMedications.medication: Adderall XR Oral Capsule Extended Release 24 Hour 20 MG

activeMedications.instructions: TAKE ONCE EVERY 12 HOURS FOR PAIN.
